game.title: Zinnia on the ISS
game.pausedDesc: Mission is paused. Resources are not changing.
game.menuObjectiveDesc: Keep the zinnia alive for 5 minutes until it blooms. Monitor resources and respond to space events.

won.successDesc: You have successfully grown a zinnia in space
won.realExperimentDesc: On January 16, 2016, the orange zinnia became the first flower to bloom in space. This Veggie project experiment on the ISS faced real challenges: excess humidity, mold risk, and constant adjustments. The success demonstrated that it is possible to grow fresh food on long-duration space missions.

tutorial.contextDesc: In 2016, astronaut Scott Kelly successfully grew the first flower in space: an orange zinnia. This experiment demonstrated that it is possible to grow flowering plants in microgravity, a crucial step for future missions to Mars.
tutorial.missionPoint1: Keep resources in optimal ranges (green zone)
tutorial.missionPoint2: The ISS orbits Earth every 15 seconds (day/night)
tutorial.missionPoint4: Keep the plant alive for 5 minutes until flowering
tutorial.tip1: Tap (i) buttons to learn about each resource
tutorial.tipHardMode1: In hard mode: using controls consumes energy

lost.defaultFailure: The plant could not complete its growth cycle in time.
lost.advice1: Keep resources in the green (optimal) zone
lost.advice2: Adjust resources before they reach the red zone
lost.advice3: During events, prioritize the most affected resources
lost.adviceHardMode1: Manage energy well, it is limited
lost.failureDesc: The zinnia did not survive this time
